dataType.name: GenericCoordValue
dataType.description: This data type contains the generic coordinate value and a reference to a GenericFrame through a coordinate axis and Coordinate Space object.

objectType.name: GenericFrame
objectType.description: A Generic Coordinate Frame allows coordinates other than Time, Space, Spectral, Redshift, and Polarization to the defined; e.g., flux, temperature, pressure, etc. It SHALL contain one Generic Coordinate Space object.

objectType.name: GenericCoordSpace
objectType.description: The GenericCoordSpace SHALL include one CoordAxis object.

package.name: pixel
package.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

literal.name: right
literal.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

literal.name: left
literal.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: PixelCoordinate
dataType.description: A PixelCoordinate is a real-valued coordinate in 1-, 2-, or 3-dimensional pixel space, with each component referenced to its pixel frame through its associated Pixel Axis. This data type specifies an arbitrary location in the Pixel Frame, rather than identifying a specific pixel. The vector is built up from RealPixelValue scalar components.

dataType.name: PixelCoord1D
dataType.description: The 1-dimensional Pixel Coordinate value.

dataType.name: PixelCoord3D
dataType.description: The 3-dimensional Pixel Coordinate value.

dataType.name: PixelCoord2D
dataType.description: The 2-dimensional Pixel Coordinate value.

dataType.name: PixelIndex
dataType.description: The 1-dimensional Pixel Index value.

dataType.name: RealPixelValue
dataType.description: The 1-dimensional pixel value, to be used for non-index (non-integer) pixel coordinate values, such as may result from analysis calculations.

objectType.name: PixelFrame
objectType.description: A PixelFrame forms the Coordinate Frame for a 1-D, 2-D, or 3-D PixelSpace, and is included in the PixelCoordSystem. It SHALL contain one PixelSpace object. Note that, unlike other coordinate frames, a Pixel Frame SHOULD have at least one Frame Transform mapping: pixels without reference to the wider world are meaningless.

objectType.name: PixelSpace
objectType.description: A PixelSpace SHALL include one, two, or three ordered PixelAxis objects, defining a pixel object (sub)set that can be the native or target space for a FrameTransform mapping object.

attribute.name: handedness
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: PolCoordValue
dataType.description: The abstract data type PolCoordValue contains a reference to a PolarizationFrame through a DiscreteAxis and PolarizationSpace object and allows the equivalent data types PolStokes, PolCircular, PolLinear, and PolVector coordinate values to be specified as derived data types.

dataType.name: PolStokes
dataType.description: Stokes polarization coordinate value.

dataType.name: PolCircular
dataType.description: Circular polarization coordinate value.

dataType.name: PolLinear
dataType.description: Linear polarization coordinate value.

dataType.name: PolVector
dataType.description: Vector polarization coordinate value.

objectType.name: PolarizationFrame
objectType.description: A Polarization Frame SHALL contain one PolarizationSpace object. It may need a reference to a spatial frame (TBD).

objectType.name: PolarizationSpace
objectType.description: The PolarizationSpace SHALL include one DiscreteAxis object, since polarization is an enumerated coordinate.

dataType.name: RedshiftValue
dataType.description: The abstract data type RedshiftValue contains a reference to a RedshiftFrame through the coordinate axis and Spectral Space objects and allows the equivalent data types Redshift and DopplerVelocity coordinate values to be specified as derived data types.

dataType.name: Redshift
dataType.description: The RedshiftValue expressed as a unitless redshift (z)

dataType.name: DopplerVelocity
dataType.description: The RedshiftValue expressed as a DopplerVelocity, requiring a DopplerDefinition (default: optical).

objectType.name: RedshiftFrame
objectType.description: The RedshiftFrame is the Frame for redshift and Doppler velocity coordinates. It requires a Reference Position in the associated AstroCoordSystem object (which need to be specified in phase space) and SHALL include a RedshiftSpace.

objectType.description: The RedshiftSpace SHALL include one CoordAxis object, which will typically not include any of its optional attributes other than Name.

dataType.name: Location
dataType.description: The abstract data type that specifies a specific spatial location. It may either be a StdLocation (which absolute location in phase space is known by definition, if necessary aided by a planetary ephemeris) or a Custom Spatial Location (which provides coordinates in an associated SpaceFrame). Although this data type may be used anywhere, it is especially designed for us as a Reference Position in the AstroCoordSystem object.

dataType.name: StdLocation
dataType.description: Derived from data type Location. An absolute a priori known location in phase space (position and velocity), chosen from the StdRefPos enumeration. Considering that the GEOCENTER is really the only place for which we know the absolute location at all times, all other locations require the specification of a planetary ephemeris, although that may be defaulted to DE405. LSR[KD] are reserved for spectrall and redshift frames. TOPOCENTER (location of the observer) is special in that it assumes that the observing location is available through other means (e.g., a geographic location or an orbit ephemeris). RELOCATABLE is availlable for simulations. UNKNOWNRefPos should only be used if absolutely necessary.

attribute.name: location
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: CustomLocation
dataType.description: Derived from data type Location. This is the abstract data type (to be instantiated as a set of 1D, 2D, or 3D cpatial coordinates specifying the position and/or velocity. This abstract data type contains a reference to an instance of a SpatialFrame and, optionally, an Epoch.

attribute.name: epoch
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: position
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: velocity
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: Epoch
dataType.description: Epoch data type, containing EpochType (default: J) and epoch expressed in years.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: year
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: SpatialValue
dataType.description: The abstract data type SpatialValue contains a reference to a SpatialFrame through the coordinate axis and Spatial Space and allows the 1-, 2-, and 3-dimensional coordinate values to be specified as derived data types. It MAY include an epoch. The spatial coordinate value is built from SpatialCoordValue scalar components. Note that SpatialValue may contain either positions or velocities. The latter are restricted to true space velocities; Doppler velocities belong in the redshift domain.

attribute.name: epoch
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: SpatialValue1D
dataType.description: 1-dimensional spatial coordinate value.

dataType.name: SpatialValue2D
dataType.description: 2-dimensional spatial coordinate value. Each component references its own axis.

dataType.name: SpatialValue3D
dataType.description: 3-dimensional spatial coordinate value. Each component references its own axis.

dataType.name: SpatialCoordValue
dataType.description: Single-axis spatial coordinate value, to be used as component in the general SpatialValue data type.

objectType.name: SpaceFrame
objectType.description: A Spatial Frame is specified by its Reference Frame (currently only standard reference frames are allowed), a Reference Position (provided in the associated AstroCoordSystem object), and a SpatialSpace object; an Equinox is optional and only required for pre-ICRS reference frames; an epoh is also optional. It is to be referenced by spatial coordinates (Position and Velocity).

attribute.name: spaceRefFrame
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: refPosition
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: equinox
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: epoch
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: planetaryEphem
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: SpatialSpace
objectType.description: The abstract SpatialSpace is derived from CoordSpace and SHALL contain one, two, or three coordinate axes whose attributes may all be relevant. Different flavors may be derived from this class: Spherical, Cartesian, Cylindrical, Polar, UnitSphere, HTM, HealPix. At this time only Spherical and Cartesian are provided.

objectType.name: Spherical
objectType.description: To be used for Spherical spatiall coordinates. The native order is: longitude, latitude, radius.

objectType.name: Cartesian
objectType.description: To be used for Cartesian spatial coordinates, 1-, 2-, or 3-dimensional. The native order is X, Y, Z; right-handed.

package.name: spectral
package.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: SpectralValue
dataType.description: The abstract data type SpectralValue contains a reference to a SpectralFrame through the coordinate axis and Spectral Space and allows the equivalent data types Frequency, Energy, and Wavelength coordinate values to be specified as derived data types.

dataType.name: Frequency
dataType.description: Spectral coordinate value expressed as a frequency.

dataType.name: Energy
dataType.description: Spectral coordinate value expressed as an energy.

dataType.name: Wavelength
dataType.description: Spectral coordinate value expressed as a wavelength. Note that a refractive index is required for proper interpretation of wavelength; if absent, a value of 0.0 (vacuum) will be assumed.

attribute.name: refrindex
attribute.description: Refractive index of the medium in which the wavelength is measured; default=0.0.

objectType.name: SpectralFrame
objectType.description: The SpectralFrame is the Frame for spectral coordinates. It requires a Reference Position (in the AstroCoordSystem and which need to be specified in phase space) and SHALL contain a Spectral Space object.

attribute.name: refPosition
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: planetaryEphem
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: SpectralSpace
objectType.description: The SpectralSpace SHALL include one CoordAxis object, which will typically not include any of its optional attributes other than Name, although domainMin could trivially be set to zero, of course.

dataType.name: ISOtime
dataType.description: ISOtime is a Time Stamp expressed as an ISO-8601 string, within the restrictions imposed by the IVOA: no time zone information is allowed, the string needs to be of the form [+|-c]ccyy-mm-dd[Thh:mm:ss[.s...]]

dataType.name: JD
dataType.description: JD is a Time Stamp expressed in Julian Days. Note that JD does not properly specify a time stamp, unless it is related to a time scale and a reference position. One shoulld be aware that precision can easily become an issue with JD, as the numbers tend to be large.

dataType.name: MJD
dataType.description: MJD is a Time Stamp expressed in Modified Julian Days. T(MJD)=T(JD)-2440000.5.

dataType.name: TimeOffset
dataType.description: TimeOffset specifies the offset in time of the Time Stamp relative to the Time Origin in the associated Time Frame

dataType.name: TimeStamp
dataType.description: A TimeStamp specifies a specific time instance and may be expressed as JD, MJD, ISO-8601, or an offset from a specific point in time (which has to be a Time Stamp). The contents of the Time Stamp references an instance of a time axis.

dataType.name: JDTime
dataType.description: Basic astronomical time is specified as Julian Dates (or Modified Julian Dates). The numbers are unitlless, although the implied unit is, of course, 'd'.

dataType.name: DatetimeQuantity
dataType.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: TimeFrame
objectType.description: A TimeFrame SHALL include a Time Scale and a TimeSpace and MAY include a Reference Direction, and/or a Time Origin (for elapsed time).

attribute.name: timeScale
attribute.description: The Time Scale sets the reference frame for the Time Frame.

attribute.name: refPosition
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: refDirection
attribute.description: The reference direction is needed if time stampes are transformed to a time frame with a different reference position (contained in the (Astro)CoordSystem). In those situations the solar system ephemeris also comes into play.

attribute.name: timeOrigin
attribute.description: The Time Origin needs to refer to the same TimeAxis as the TimeOffsets that refer to this TimeFrame. This may seem like a recursive anomaly, but is necessary in order to prevent accidents.

attribute.name: planetaryEphem
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: TimeSpace
objectType.description: The TimeSpace SHALL include one CoordAxis object, which will typically not include any of its optional attributes orther than Name, although this will be left open in case it is deemed desirable to allow derived time axes such as phase to be specified.

package.name: coords
package.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: CoordValue
dataType.description: Abstract top level 1-dimensional coordinate value data type. There are four sub-types: simple integer and real for pixel spaces; discrete for enumerated coordinates; and the most commonly used physical coordinate value. It refers to a CoordFrame using coordAxis through an Axis and a CoordSpace object.

reference.name: coordAxis
reference.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: MultiCoordValue
dataType.description: The value for vector coordinates. The vector is built up from scalar CoordValue components.

attribute.name: cmpt
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: PhysicalCoordValue
dataType.description: Most common coordinate value type. The value is an (abstract) Quantity that needs to be further specified in each domain. The coordAxis is subsetted to an object of type CoordAxis.

attribute.name: cval
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: IntegerCoordValue
dataType.description: Integer-valued coordinate specifically intended for pixel index values.

attribute.name: cval
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: RealCoordValue
dataType.description: Real-valued coordinate specifically intended for use in pixel spaces.

attribute.name: cval
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

dataType.name: BasicCoordValue
dataType.description: Abstract top-level coordinate value data type. Derived from this are various 1-dimensional coordinate value types and one multi-dimensional type.

dataType.name: DiscreteCoordValue
dataType.description: Coordinate value for discrete (enumerated) coordinate axes. The actual type of the value needs to be specified in the coordinate domain. The coordAxis is subsetted to DiscreteAxis. For an example, see the polarization domain.

package.name: coordsystem
package.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: CoordFrame
objectType.description: This is the abstract empty base class for all coordinate frames. A Frame SHALL contain one corresponding Coordinate Space.

composition.name: coordSpace
composition.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: AstroCoordSystem
objectType.description: An AstroCoordSystem MAY contain any number of coordinate frames: GenericFrame, TimeFrame, SpaceFrame, SpectralFrame, RedshiftFrame, PolarizationFrame. In addition, it SHALL contain the common reference position (refPosition) for the astronomical frames and it MAY contain the name of a planetary ephemeris (which SHOULD be included when appropriate).

objectType.name: CoordSys
objectType.description: A Coordinate System is a collection of Coordinate Frames. This class is the base-level coordinate system and MAY contain any number of generic coordinate frames.

reference.name: genericFrame
reference.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: PixelCoordSystem
objectType.description: A Pixel Coordinate System contains one or more Pixel Frames.

composition.name: pixelFrame
composition.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: Axis
objectType.description: Axis is the abstract parent class for all coordinate axes. It SHALL contain the name of the axis.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Label for the first axis.

objectType.name: CoordSpace
objectType.description: The CoordSpace is the abstract class from which all coordinate spaces are derived. It contains up to three coordinate axes.

composition.name: coordAxis
composition.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: CoordAxis
objectType.description: CoordAxis is the most common type of coordinate axis, derived from Axis. It MAY contain a nativeAxisIndex if its coordinate space consists of more than one axis; the minimum and maximum allowable coordinate value along the axis in its domain (only if meaningful, of course); and a flag indicating whether the axis is cyclic (default: false).

attribute.name: nativeAxisIndex
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: domainMin
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: domainMax
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

attribute.name: cyclic
attribute.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: DiscreteAxis
objectType.description: DiscreteAxis is specifically intended for enumerated coordinates, such as polarization.

objectType.name: PixelAxis
objectType.description: PixelAxis is the derived Axis class for pixel spaces. It SHALL contain its axis index in the PixelSpace and the number of pixels along the axis.
